description: Universal SAP shortcuts and resources across all solutions

globalShortcuts.name: SAP for Me
globalShortcuts.notes: One-stop hub for licenses, users, contracts, and entitlements. Your central SAP portal.

globalShortcuts.name: Cloud Service Status
globalShortcuts.notes: Green checkmarks = System is up. Red X = SAP outage. Check before troubleshooting.

globalShortcuts.name: SAP Support Portal
globalShortcuts.notes: Open incidents, search KBAs, check component ownership. Your first stop for issues.

globalShortcuts.name: SAP Community
globalShortcuts.notes: Q&A and best practices. Search before asking - 80% of questions already answered.

globalShortcuts.name: Discovery Center
globalShortcuts.notes: BTP cost estimator and reference architectures. Essential for planning cloud projects.

globalShortcuts.name: SAP Roadmap Explorer
globalShortcuts.notes: Use to answer: 'When is this feature coming?' Product roadmaps across SAP portfolio.

notes.title: Data Analysis Pattern
notes.content:
"Analyze [dataset/object] for [time period] and highlight [top insights/drivers/risks]. Present results as [format: table/summary/5 bullet points]."

Example: "Analyze sales orders for Q1 2025 and highlight top 5 blockers by revenue impact. Present as executive summary."

notes.title: Action with Explanation
notes.content:
"Perform [action] for [scope], then explain what you did and how it affects [business outcome]."

Example: "Create a draft invoice for PO 4500012345, then explain how this affects our cash flow forecast for the month."

notes.title: Scenario Simulation
notes.content:
"Simulate [business change] and show the impact on [KPI] by [dimension], including recommendations for mitigation or optimization."

Example: "Simulate a 10% price increase on Product Line A and show impact on revenue, margin, and customer churn by region with recommendations."

notes.title: Multi-Step Orchestration
notes.content:
"For [scope]: 1) [Analysis step], 2) [Classification/prioritization step], 3) [Action/output generation step]."

Example: "For customer ACME: 1) List all open orders with delivery dates in next 30 days, 2) Flag high-risk orders due to material shortages or credit blocks, 3) Draft email to account manager with action plan and escalation points."

notes.title: Joule Installation & Activation Guide (All Products)
notes.content:
=== SuccessFactors Joule ===
SAP Note 3377766 - Joule Copilot Activation for SuccessFactors
https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/3377766

Prerequisites:
• SuccessFactors H1 2025 release or later
• OAuth integration configured
• User roles: Joule User, Joule Admin

Activation Steps:
1. Admin Center → System Configuration → Joule Settings
2. Enable "Joule Copilot" toggle
3. Configure SSO (SAML 2.0)
4. Assign roles to users
5. Test: "Show my team's time off requests"

=== S/4HANA Joule ===
SAP Note 3391234 - Joule for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Activation
https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/3391234

Prerequisites:
• S/4HANA Cloud 2408 or later
• SAP Fiori launchpad configured
• BTP subaccount with AI services

Activation Steps:
1. Fiori Launchpad → Manage Joule Settings
2. Connect BTP AI Core tenant
3. Enable role: SAP_BR_JOULE_USER
4. Test: "What's my cash position?"

=== SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Joule ===
SAP Note 3405123 - Joule for SAP Analytics Cloud
https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/3405123

Prerequisites:
• SAC tenant on latest release
• Story creation permissions
• Data models published

Activation Steps:
1. SAC → System → Administration → Joule
2. Enable "Natural Language Query"
3. Test: "Show revenue trend by region"

=== BTP Generative AI Hub ===
SAP Note 3405678 - BTP Generative AI Hub Setup
https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/3405678

Prerequisites:
• BTP global account with AI Units entitlement
• Cloud Foundry space with 2GB memory
• Service key for AI Core

Setup Steps:
1. BTP Cockpit → AI Core → Create Instance
2. Subscribe to Generative AI Hub service
3. Create destination to foundation models (GPT-4, Claude)
4. Build skills: https://www.sap.com/products/artificial-intelligence/generative-ai-hub-trial.html

Common Issues & Fixes:
❌ "Joule icon not showing" → Clear browser cache + relogin
❌ "OAuth error" → Regenerate OAuth client secret
❌ "No response" → Check status: https://me.sap.com/app/availability

Additional Resources:
• Joule Community: https://community.sap.com/topics/joule
• Joule Help: https://help.sap.com/joule
• Joule Roadmap: https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?q=joule

notes.title: AI Pricing: FUE vs PUPM (2026 Update)
notes.content:
FUE (Full Use Equivalent):
• Traditional SAP licensing model
• 1 FUE = 1 "power user" with full system access
• Used for: SuccessFactors, S/4HANA Cloud
• Ratios: 1 Advanced = 1 FUE | 5 Core = 1 FUE | 30 Self-Service = 1 FUE

PUPM (Per User Per Month):
• Cloud subscription model (monthly, pay-as-you-go)
• Used for: BTP services, SAP Analytics Cloud
• Example: $10/user/month for SAP Build

Business AI Pricing (NEW in 2026):
• Joule Base - Included in FUE license (no extra cost)
• Joule Premium Skills - $15/user/month add-on
• Generative AI Hub (BTP) - $0.50 per 1000 API calls
• Document Grounding - $5/user/month for custom content

Key Decision:
• FUE = Predictable annual costs (enterprise contracts)
• PUPM = Flexible monthly costs (startups, pilots)
• AI Add-ons = Usually PUPM, even if base product is FUE

Resources:
• SAP Store Pricing: https://store.sap.com
• License Calculator: https://me.sap.com/app/licenseutilization

notes.title: Move to Clean Core (2026 Reality Check)
notes.content:
Clean Core = Keep SAP standard, extend on BTP (no custom code in core).

Why Clean Core Matters:
✓ Quarterly cloud updates (not 6-12 month upgrade projects)
✓ 40-60% reduction in upgrade costs
✓ AI/Joule works out-of-box (doesn't break with custom code)
✓ Future-proof (no technical debt)

The 3 Rules of Clean Core:
1. Don't Modify Core - No Y- or Z-tables in SAP systems
2. Extend on BTP - Build side-by-side apps on BTP
3. Use APIs Only - No direct DB access, use SAP APIs

Common Challenges:
✗ "We have 500 custom programs" - Start with top 20, migrate incrementally
✗ "BTP is expensive" - TCO is lower than maintaining custom code
✗ "Our business is unique" - 80% processes are industry-standard

Migration Path:
1. Identify custom code (Transaction: /SDF/CD_CBA)
2. Classify: Keep, Replace with SAP Standard, Rebuild on BTP
3. Use Extensibility Explorer: https://sap.com/extends4

Key Resources:
• Clean Core Checker: https://support.sap.com/cleancore
• SAP Signavio (Process Mining): https://signavio.com

notes.title: SAP RISE & GROW (What You Need to Know)
notes.content:
SAP RISE = ERP Transformation as a Service
• All-in-one: S/4HANA + BTP + Business AI + Infrastructure
• Subscription model (no more perpetual licenses)
• Includes: Hyperscaler hosting (AWS/Azure/GCP) + managed services
• Target: Mid-to-large enterprises (>$100M revenue)

SAP GROW = SMB-Focused Cloud ERP
• S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (pre-configured)
• Faster implementation (3-6 months vs 12-18 months)
• Lower cost ($200-500/user/month all-in)
• Target: SMBs (<$100M revenue)

Key Differences:
Feature | RISE | GROW
Implementation | 12-18 months | 3-6 months
Customization | Moderate (BTP extensions) | Minimal (out-of-box)
Price | $500-2000/user/year | $200-500/user/month
Target | Enterprise | SMB

Common Questions:
Q: "Do I need BTP skills for RISE?"
A: Yes, for extensions. But SAP provides consultants.

Q: "Can I switch from GROW to RISE?"
A: Yes, GROW is a stepping stone to RISE.

Q: "Is RISE just S/4HANA Cloud?"
A: No, it's S/4 + BTP + AI + Infrastructure + Services.

Resources:
• RISE FAQ: https://www.sap.com/products/erp/rise.html
• GROW FAQ: https://www.sap.com/products/erp/grow.html

notes.title: SAP Joule Studio (Build Custom AI Skills)
notes.content:
Joule Studio is SAP's low-code platform to build custom Joule skills.

What You Can Build:
• Custom chatbot responses for company policies
• Task automation (e.g., "Approve all invoices under $500")
• Domain-specific queries (e.g., "What's our Q4 headcount forecast?")
• Integration with 3rd-party data (Salesforce, Workday)

How It Works:
1. Skill Builder - Define intent, entities, sample questions
2. Action Builder - Connect to SAP APIs (OData, REST)
3. Test Playground - Test skill with sample prompts
4. Deploy - Publish to Joule in SuccessFactors/S/4HANA

Example Skill:
"Show me open requisitions in San Francisco"
→ Calls SF Recruiting OData API
→ Filters by location = "San Francisco"
→ Returns results in conversational format

Key Links:
• Joule Studio: https://www.sap.com/products/artificial-intelligence/generative-ai-hub-trial.html
• Skill Templates: https://help.sap.com/joule/studio
• Community: https://community.sap.com/topics/joule

Who Should Use This:
• Citizen developers (no coding required)
• Consultants building demo tenants
• Enterprises with unique business logic
